synopsis: In episode #10, Devam and Ahir welcome Rishabh Meswani, founder of the Fremont Debate Academy, for a captivating discussion on the importance of debate in developing critical thinking and communication skills among students. They explore the challenges of leadership, the significance of balancing passion with personal well-being, and the evolving nature of youth engagement in extracurricular activities.
quotes: The worst case scenario doesn't have to be the end; it can be just the beginning of a new opportunity.
It's important to find something you're passionate about that you enjoy doing.
You have to give yourself the chance to explore and find your own path.
Sometimes the best way to deal with anxiety is to map out the worst case and make peace with it.
Everyone should go try to figure out what's best for them.
If you can't get fulfillment from work, then find it elsewhere.
You can't always make excuses for other people; a part of you dies every time.
Life isn't a game where you're just trying to achieve the highest number of points.
The quality of our programs has improved as we've put in more effort and time.
It's important to set expectations and communicate with the people you're working with.
